articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump and sign a critical minerals deal on Friday as Kyiv works to regain U.S. support to fight off the Russian invasion as Washington reverses its punitive policy towards Moscow.
articles.title: Trump, Zelenskiy to sign minerals deal at White House meeting

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Russia reacted with glee on Friday to the bitter clash between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy in the White House, saying the Ukrainian leader got what he deserved.
articles.title: Russians gloat over Zelenskiy's 'suicide in the White House'

articles.author: Erin Banco, Steve Holland
articles.description: The stunning blow-up between President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy at the White House came after weeks of frustration by Trump and his top aides who saw the Ukrainian leader as an obstacle to their goals of quickly ending the war, restoring ties with Moscow and sealing a potentially lucrative minerals deal, multiple sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Trump's Zelenskiy outburst a culmination of weeks of frustration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and U.S. President Donald Trumptraded blows at a White House meeting that ended in disaster on Friday, prompting an outpouring of reaction from across the globe.
articles.title: World reacts to Zelenskiy-Trump Oval Office clash

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: Canada and Mexico on Friday sought to show U.S. President Donald Trump's administration evidence of progress in curbing the flow of fentanyl opioids into the U.S. ahead of a March 4 deadline for punishing 25% tariffs on their goods imports.
articles.title: Mexico, Canada seek to forestall Trump's tariffs with anti-drug efforts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea and the U.S. have also agreed to set up a working-level channel to discuss tariff-related issues.
articles.title: South Korea's industry minister seeks exemption from Trump's tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli delegation in Cairo is negotiating to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire when it expires on Saturday rather than move to the second phase as originally planned and as Hamas wants, two Egyptian security sources said on Friday.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas diverge over ceasefire with first phase set to expire

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis had an "isolated breathing crisis" in hospital on Friday, the Vatican said, in a setback as the 88-year-old pontiff battles double pneumonia.
articles.title: Pope Francis, in setback, had 'isolated' breathing crisis, Vatican says

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: U.S. Army Lieutenant General Telita Crosland, the head of the military's health agency and one of the most senior Black female officers in the Army, was forced to retire on Friday, two sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump administration pushed out U.S. military health agency head, officials say

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.description: South Korea tightened rules on carrying lithium batteries on planes from Saturday, highlighting a growing risk to flights worldwide from the batteries used in cellphones and e-cigarettes which can malfunction to produce smoke, fire or extreme heat.
articles.title: SKorea's new lithium battery rules on planes highlight growing risk for aviation
